item.title: Lanny Davis backs off claims about 'Russia' info...
item.description:
www.sfgate.com
An attorney for Michael Cohen, President Donald Trump's former lawyer, is backing away from confident assertions he made that Cohen has information to share with investigators that shows Trump knew in 2016 of Russian efforts to undermine Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton. Lanny Davis, a spokesman and attorney for Cohen, said in an interview this weekend that he is no longer certain about claims he made to reporters on background and on the record in recent weeks about what Cohen knows about Trump's awareness of the Russian efforts. Davis did not rule out that his claims were correct but expressed regret that he did not explain that he could not independently corroborate them, saying that he now believes he "should have been more clear.

item.title: Tree falls on reporter during broadcast...
item.description:
www.sfgate.com
A reporter's dispatch from then-Hurricane Lane in Hawaii got a startling interruption when a tree fell on him mid-broadcast on Friday, according to the BBC. James Cook was delivering an update on the storm's path when nature had other ideas. "The latest forecast suggest the eye will skirt the Big Island in around 12 hours time before brushing past Maui on its way to O'ahu," Cook can be heard saying in the broadcast, when he is interrupted by a loud series of cracking and rustling noises.

item.title: NKorea newspaper blasts 'double-dealing' USA...
